pageContext.claim: “We will save the cost of the wall every year, but much more than that. Much more than that.”
pageContext.analysis: It's unclear what Trump means by this, but he appears to be talking about alleged savings from illegal immigration. (He made a more detailed claim to this effect in March.) The president often relies on dubious figures on the cost of illegal immigration. Moreover, a border wall on the southern border would not stop people from overstaying their visas. Illegal border crossings represent a relatively small share of the number of people who enter the country, legally or otherwise, in any given year, according to the Department of Homeland Security. Government data suggest that in 2016 there were about 170,000 successful illegal border crossings outside of authorized border crossing points, compared to 630,000 people overstayed visas. Studies estimate that nearly half of the undocumented immigrants residing in the United States entered the country legally with a visa.
